17#include <config.h>
18
19#include <stdlib.h>
20#include <stdarg.h>
21
22#include <isc/base64.h>
23#include <isc/buffer.h>
24#include <isc/file.h>
25#include <isc/mem.h>
26#include <isc/print.h>
27#include <isc/result.h>
28#include <isc/string.h>
29
30#include <pk11/site.h>
31
32#include <dns/keyvalues.h>
33#include <dns/name.h>

35#include <dst/dst.h>
36#include <confgen/os.h>

38#include "util.h"
39#include "keygen.h"
40
41/*%
42 * Convert algorithm type to string.
43 */
44const char *
45alg_totext(dns_secalg_t alg) {
46 switch (alg) {
47 case DST_ALG_HMACMD5:
48 return "hmac-md5";
49 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA1:
50 return "hmac-sha1";
51 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA224:
52 return "hmac-sha224";
53 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA256:
54 return "hmac-sha256";
55 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA384:
56 return "hmac-sha384";
57 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA512:
58 return "hmac-sha512";
59 default:
60 return "(unknown)";
61 }
62}
63
64/*%
65 * Convert string to algorithm type.
66 */
67dns_secalg_t
68alg_fromtext(const char *name) {
69 const char *p = name;
70 if (strncasecmp(p, "hmac-", 5) == 0)
71 p = &name[5];
72
73 if (strcasecmp(p, "md5") == 0)
74 return DST_ALG_HMACMD5;
75 if (strcasecmp(p, "sha1") == 0)
76 return DST_ALG_HMACSHA1;
77 if (strcasecmp(p, "sha224") == 0)
78 return DST_ALG_HMACSHA224;
79 if (strcasecmp(p, "sha256") == 0)
80 return DST_ALG_HMACSHA256;
81 if (strcasecmp(p, "sha384") == 0)
82 return DST_ALG_HMACSHA384;
83 if (strcasecmp(p, "sha512") == 0)
84 return DST_ALG_HMACSHA512;
85 return DST_ALG_UNKNOWN;
86}
87
88/*%
89 * Return default keysize for a given algorithm type.
90 */
91int
92alg_bits(dns_secalg_t alg) {
93 switch (alg) {
94 case DST_ALG_HMACMD5:
95 return 128;
96 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA1:
97 return 160;
98 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA224:
99 return 224;
100 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA256:
101 return 256;
102 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA384:
103 return 384;
104 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA512:
105 return 512;
106 default:
107 return 0;
108 }
109}
110
111/*%
112 * Generate a key of size 'keysize' and place it in 'key_txtbuffer'
113 */
114void
115generate_key(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_secalg_t alg, int keysize,
116 isc_buffer_t *key_txtbuffer) {
117 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
118 isc_buffer_t key_rawbuffer;
119 isc_region_t key_rawregion;
120 char key_rawsecret[64];
121 dst_key_t *key = NULL;
122
123 switch (alg) {
124 case DST_ALG_HMACMD5:
125 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA1:
126 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA224:
127 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA256:
128 if (keysize < 1 || keysize > 512)
129 fatal("keysize %d out of range (must be 1-512)\n",
130 keysize);
131 break;
132 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA384:
133 case DST_ALG_HMACSHA512:
134 if (keysize < 1 || keysize > 1024)
135 fatal("keysize %d out of range (must be 1-1024)\n",
136 keysize);
137 break;
138 default:
139 fatal("unsupported algorithm %d\n", alg);
140 }
141
142 DO("initialize dst library", dst_lib_init(mctx, NULL));
143
144 DO("generate key", dst_key_generate(dns_rootname, alg,
145 keysize, 0, 0, DNS_KEYPROTO_ANY,
146 dns_rdataclass_in, mctx, &key,
147 NULL));
148
149 isc_buffer_init(&key_rawbuffer, &key_rawsecret, sizeof(key_rawsecret));
150
151 DO("dump key to buffer", dst_key_tobuffer(key, &key_rawbuffer));
152
153 isc_buffer_usedregion(&key_rawbuffer, &key_rawregion);
154
155 DO("bsse64 encode secret", isc_base64_totext(&key_rawregion, -1, "",
156 key_txtbuffer));
157
158 if (key != NULL)
159 dst_key_free(&key);
160
161 dst_lib_destroy();
162}
163
164/*%
165 * Write a key file to 'keyfile'. If 'user' is non-NULL,
166 * make that user the owner of the file. The key will have
167 * the name 'keyname' and the secret in the buffer 'secret'.
168 */
169void
170write_key_file(const char *keyfile, const char *user,
171 const char *keyname, isc_buffer_t *secret,
172 dns_secalg_t alg) {
173 isc_result_t result;
174 const char *algname = alg_totext(alg);
175 FILE *fd = NULL;
176
177 DO("create keyfile", isc_file_safecreate(keyfile, &fd));
178
179 if (user != NULL) {
180 if (set_user(fd, user) == -1)
181 fatal("unable to set file owner\n");
182 }
183
184 fprintf(fd, "key \"%s\" {\n\talgorithm %s;\n"
185 "\tsecret \"%.*s\";\n};\n",
186 keyname, algname,
187 (int)isc_buffer_usedlength(secret),
188 (char *)isc_buffer_base(secret));
189 fflush(fd);
190 if (ferror(fd))
191 fatal("write to %s failed\n", keyfile);
192 if (fclose(fd))
193 fatal("fclose(%s) failed\n", keyfile);
194 fprintf(stderr, "wrote key file \"%s\"\n", keyfile);
195}
